senses.de: Involving or extending over a long period.
senses.ex: The long-term effects of smoking are devastating.

Tips.title: Describing future plans
Tips.description: Use 'long-term' to talk about plans or goals that will take a considerable amount of time to achieve.
Tips.example: My long-term goal is to own my own business.

Tips.title: Discussing investments
Tips.description: Use 'long-term' to describe investments that are meant to be held for an extended period.
Tips.example: I'm looking for long-term investment opportunities.

Tips.title: Talking about health effects
Tips.description: Use 'long-term' to describe the effects of something on health over a long period.
Tips.example: The long-term effects of this medication are still unknown.

Long-lasting.wordDefinition: 'Long-lasting' emphasizes the duration of something, while 'long-term' emphasizes the planning or impact over an extended period. 'Long-lasting' often refers to the durability of an object or the persistence of an effect, whereas 'long-term' often refers to goals, strategies, or consequences.

Extended.wordDefinition: 'Extended' implies a lengthening of something that already exists, while 'long-term' suggests something planned or considered over a long period from the beginning. 'Extended' can refer to a temporary lengthening, while 'long-term' implies a more permanent or inherent duration.
